greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write n as n = u*v*w with 1 <= u < v < w.
comment: a(n)=0 iff n=1 or n prime or n prime^2: a(A000430(n)) = 0.

The integers a(n)+1 equal A045778(n) for n < 120 and differ at all n that admit factorization into 4 or more distinct factors, the smallest ones being n = 120 = 2*3*4*5, n = 144 = 2*3*4*6, n = 168 = 2*3*4*7, n = 180 = 2*3*5*6, ..., later continuing n = 312 = 2*3*4*13, n = 320 = 2*4*5*8, n = 324 = 2*3*6*9, n = 330 = 2*3*5*11, ... Coincidentally, A068350(5) to A068350(19) start this list. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 19 2007
link: Antti Karttunen and Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (first 2048 terms from Antti Karttunen.)
Michael De Vlieger, Records and first positions of records in A088434.
program: (PARI) A088434(n) = { my(s=0); fordiv(n, u, for(v=u+1, n-1, for(w=v+1, n, if(u*v*w==n, s++)))); (s); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 24 2017
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 01 2003
ext: Data section extended to 120 terms by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 24 2017
